name: ssl-labs-test
description: Analyse the SSL configuration of any public web server using the Qualys SSL Labs SSL Server test.
author: Kasun Kodagoda

inputs.name: hostname
inputs.label: Hostname to Analyse
inputs.helpMarkDown: The hostname of the web server to analyse.

inputs.name: freshScan
inputs.label: Execute Fresh Scan
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set this to make sure a fresh analysis is executed. If not a cached version of the analysis will be taken. Defaults to _false_

inputs.name: publishScanResults
inputs.label: Publish  Analysis Results
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set this if you want to publish the SSL Labs publicly on their web site. Defaults to _false_

inputs.name: enableVerification
inputs.label: Enable Verifications
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set this if you want to enable verifications for the SSL Certificate. Supports checking for Certificate Grade for now. Defaults to _false_.

inputs.name: minimumCertGrade
inputs.label: Minimum Certificate Grade
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set this if you want to define a minimum grade for the certificate. If empty the value defaults to _A_

inputs.name: enableExpirationAlert
inputs.label: Enable Certificate Expiration Alerts
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set this if you want to enable certificate expiration alerts. This will give you two options. 1). Fail the build upon expiration 2). Set a variable and its content for later use.

inputs.name: daysBeforeExpiration
inputs.label: Number of Days Certificate Expiration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set this to configure the alert to fire when there are defined number of days before the certificate expired.

inputs.name: alertMode
inputs.label: Alert Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the mode for the alerts. Either break the build if the expiration fails or set a custom build variable to use later.

inputs.name: variableName
inputs.label: Output Variable Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the custom output variable you need to set.

inputs.name: variableContent
inputs.label: Output Variable Content
inputs.helpMarkDown: The content you need to include in the output variable.
